properties.address: Branch Community Church at Emmanuel Chapel, Henbury, Bristol BS10 7BN
properties.description: Join us for a warm space and a warm plate! Enjoy a hot meal, hot drink and pudding.
properties.title: Branch Community Church

properties.description: Every Thursday from 3pm till 6.30pm Hot meal served at 5.15pm Availability of shower
properties.title: Bristol Citadel Salvation Army

properties.address: The Church of the Ascension (Keedwell Church), Bristol, Avon BS41 9DZ
properties.description: A warm welcome space in a church hall in the centre of the village. Friendly volunteers, hot drinks, biscuits and occasionally cakes are available. Drop in and join us for a cuppa and a chat, meet new people or just enjoy a change of scene in a warm space. We have puzzles, magazines, book swop, games and crafts available. We look forward to seeing you.
properties.title: Cafe@Keedwell

properties.address: 286 Filton Avenue, Horfield, Bristol BS7 0BA
properties.description: Open from 01-10-2023. Warm welcoming space for local residents in Horfield, Lockleaze and Filton areas of Bristol to connect with each other.
properties.title: Ebenezer Church

properties.address: Hillfields Library, Summerleaze, Bristol, Bristol BS16 4HL
properties.description: Our Monday Welcome Space has lots of free activities, free hot drinks and a Food Club of £3 cash for a large bag of good quality food. The group is open to anyone living in or near Hillfields, East Bristol. Our Friday group, Silver Explorers is a free social group to anyone over the age of 60 who would like to come along for free activities and warm drinks.
properties.title: Friends of Hillfields Library

properties.address: Holy Trinity Church , Bristol, City Of BS7 8ST
properties.description: A warm church space, open to everyone.
properties.title: Holy Trinity Church, Horfield, Bristol

properties.address: The Hub, Fedden buildings, Gainsborough Square, Lockleaze, Bristol BS7 9FB
properties.description: This is a pop-up cafe every Wednesday providing a warm welcome and affordable hot drinks and snacks. Fortnightly drop-in advice sessions from housing advice charity Housing Matters starting 1 November 11- 1pm. Signposting for support and advice as needed. We are open Monday to Friday 9.30 - 3.00 for people to pop-in, get signposting or for a chat. Our warm welcome space is open Wednesday 10.30 - 1.30pm, plus various events both free and affordable throughout the week and we can point you to other spaces locally where you can work and eat at other times.
properties.title: Hubbub

properties.address: Knowle Methodist Church, Bristol, Bristol BS4 2EP
properties.description: "pay as you feel" welcoming space with tea and coffee, home made soup and occasional other special lunches, a friendly chat and the opportunity to do some relaxing art or play a game.
properties.title: Knowle (South Bristol) Methodist Church

properties.address: St Agnes Church, Bristol, Bristol BS2 9LL BS2 9LL
properties.description: Hot soup lunch and friendly atmosphere in St Agnes Church hall on Tuesdays from 12.30pm to 3.30pm.
properties.title: Melanie Otto

properties.address: 4 Waring House, Bristol, Avon BS1 6TB
properties.description: We're a friendly community space open to drop-in for a chat, rest, listening ear, hot drink and to use wifi, charging points or computers. We also offer basic information and advice around finances with help filling out forms.
properties.title: Redcliffe Hub

properties.address: Flax Bourton Church, Flax Bourton, North Somerset BS48 3QQ
properties.description: Warm Welcome Cafe offering light refreshments and craft activities.
properties.title: Relax@Flax

properties.address: Little Stoke Baptist Church, Bristol, Avon BS34 6JW
properties.description: A welcoming space offering hot and cold drinks, biscuits, cake and a light lunch (Thursday only). We also offer second hand clothes and table top items. Once a month there is a creative workshop (Thursday only)
properties.title: Rev. Tania Vaughan

properties.address: St. Barnabas Church, Avon BS4 1DQ
properties.description: Open to all. Morning coffee, tea and refreshments. Hot light meal at lunchtime. Chat, activities, company.
properties.title: St Barnabas Church

properties.address: St. Peters Methodist Church, Avon BS4 4NZ
properties.description: Welcoming space with tea and coffee, home made soup, and the opportunity to chat, bring your toddler to play or play a game
properties.title: St Peter's Methodist Church

properties.address: Hanham Methodist Church, South Gloucestershire BS15 8SD
properties.description: Our pay-as-you-can cafe in Hanham is open to everyone. We serve breakfast, lunch, snacks and homemade cakes alongside great coffee, hot chocolate, chai latte, teas, milkshakes and soft drinks. We have a separate children's area with a selection of toys and plenty of space to run around. We regularly have supermarket surplus and fresh fruit, veg and salad from our Community Allotment available to take home. We run regular events including a monthly Eat & Meet, Knit & Craft and a weekly Bumps, Babies & Tots Meetup. Everything is pay-as-you-can and all contributions are anonymous.
properties.title: The Beacon Cafe Welcome Space

properties.address: Holy Trinity Church Hall, South Gloucestershire BS15 4AB
properties.description: Trinity Welcome Space is open every Thursday 12pm - 5pm. Refreshments available (tea, coffee, squash, pastries plus soup when available). Surplus bread and pastries available to take home. Regular support and advice events including visits from other organisations. Wellbeing sessions available. Free charging points, always a friendly face.
